page.title: 17RELIGION IN BALLIDON
page.content: All Saint's church, a Chapel of Ease of Bradbourne is a simple building consisting of a plain nave and chancel with seating for 70. The building itseld shows that a church existed here in the days of the Normans, many of the Norman features were 'restored' during the last century. A Directory of 1857 mentions that the church was 'renewed & thoroughly renovated in 1837 at a cost of Â£80, raised by subscriptions, later directories speak of it being restored at a cost of Â£570 in the 1880s. An unusual feature in the fire place high up in the west wall, used to be a loft which provided over-night lodging for a priest from Bradbourne to celebrate early mass, in the days when the church, along with the mother church at Bradbourne belonged to the Priory of Dunstable.There is no burial ground
